title: Consider differences in heading sensor plugin options: IMU and GPS-based

content.raw:
Background:

* Forum discussion: [https://robonationforum.vbulletin.net/forum/robotx/virtual-robotx-aa/2021-questions-about-vrx-2019-rules/page2](https://robonationforum.vbulletin.net/forum/robotx/virtual-robotx-aa/2021-questions-about-vrx-2019-rules/page2)

Issue:

At least one team is using a GPS-based heading reference:

* [[https://www.garmin.co.jp/products/on...00/#featureTab](https://www.garmin.co.jp/products/on...00/#featureTab)](https://www.garmin.co.jp/products/onthewater/gps19x_nmea2000/#featureTab)
* [https://www.furuno.com/files/Brochur...pload/sc30.pdf](https://www.furuno.com/files/Brochur...pload/sc30.pdf)

There is concern that there is significant differences between this GPS-based measurement and the IMU-based measurement simulated by the hector\_gazebo\_imu plugin currently used by VRX.

Proposed Action:

* Understand the GPS-based heading measurement - how it estimates heading and the associated noise.

    * Consider the sensor descriptions above.
    * Consider the plugin developed by the OUXT team: [https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea\_gps\_plugin](https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea_gps_plugin)
    
* Describe the sensor model from the hector\_gazebo\_imu plugin and its use in VRX
* Compare the two models 
* Consider the cost-benefit of a separate plugin to simulate the GPS-based heading measurement
